g.text: -Single point of entry for backend service
-Built on Spring Framework 6, Project Reactor and Spring Boot 3.0
-Able to match routes on any request attributes
-Predicates and filters are specific to routes
Clients make requests to Spring Cloud Gateway
If the Gateway Handler Mapping determines that a request
matches a route it is sent to the Gateway Web Handler
This handler runs the request through a filter chain that is
specific to that request. The reason the filter are divided
by dots is that the filter can run logic both before and
after the proxy request is sent all prefilter logic is
executed once it's sent to the proxy service then
Then the proxy request is made. After the logic is run
The basic building block of the gateway. It is
defined by an ID, a destination URI, a collection
of predicates, and a collection of filters.
A route is matched if the aggregate predicate is
This is a Java 8 Function Predicate. The input
type is a Spring Framework ServerWebExchange.
This lets you match on anything from the HTTP
request, such as headers or parameters
